New Records: Argentina secured a 3-0 victory over Chile in their World Cup qualifier.
Alexis Mac Allister scored the first goal in the 57th minute.
Julian Alvarez scored the second goal in the 84th minute with a long-range effort.
Paulo Dybala scored the third goal in stoppage time.
Argentina extended their lead with a comprehensive 3-0 win.
Key Match Events: Argentina opened the scoring three minutes after halftime with Mac Allister's goal.
Dybala's stoppage-time goal sealed the victory.
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina demonstrated dominance despite the absence of key players Lionel Messi and Angel Di Maria.
The match highlighted the depth of Argentina's squad.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match stats showed Argentina's control and Chile's struggles.
Argentina will face Colombia in a rematch of the Copa America final.
